trial_identification.studytitle: Effect of potassium supplementation on blood vessel function
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Acute effect of potassium supplementation on endothelial function in healthy populations

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Diseases of the vasculature and circulation including the lymphatic system

interventions.interventions: Potassium supplemented soup meal (36mmol potassium) to be consumed within 15minutes versus control with 7day washout between visits
interventions.comparator: Regular potassium soup meal (6mmol potassium) to be consumed within 15minutes

primaryOutcome.outcome: Brachial artery flow mediated dilatation (FMD) - percentage of dilatation

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: BMI greather than 18kg/m2 and less than 27kg/m2 SBP <90mmHg DBP<130mmHg weight stable for 6months
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Use of antihypertensive medication, systemic steroids, folate supplementation or non-steroidal antiinflammatory drugs. Metabolic disease such as liver or kidney disease. Treated hypertension. Previous clinical cardiovascular disease. Unable to comprehend protocol.

trial_design.concealment: The study will be advertised publicly. Participants will be enrolled and randomised to treatement order after screening. Treatment concealment is by coded containers that are administed to participants by a person independent to the study.
trial_design.sequence: The participants are assigned treatment order using a numbered random-allocation sequence generated by using a computer program (CLINSTAT software) by a person independent to the study.

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: City East Campus University of South Australia GPO Box 2471 Adelaide SA 5000

fundingsource.fundingaddress: City East Campus University of South Australia GPO Box 2471 Adelaide SA 5000

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study is to determine the effect of potassium supplementation in a single meal on blood vessel function. A high potassium intake is associated with reduced risk of heart disease however effect of potassium on blood vessel function is not known. We propose potassium supplementation will improve blood vessel function.
ethicsAndSummary.publication: Blanch N, Clifton PM, Keogh JB. Postprandial effects of potassium supplementation on vascular function and blood pressure: a randomised cross_over study. Nutrition, Metabolism and Cardiovascular Diseases. 2014;24(2):148-54. (IF 3.875)

ethicscommitee.ethicname: University of South Australia Human Research Ethics Committee
